subject: Design
title: The Nest Thermostat: Making the Invisible Beautiful
description: A quick, practical guide to The Nest Thermostat: Making the Invisible Beautiful.

hook.text: For 50 years, thermostats were beige rectangles nobody looked at. Tony Fadell thought that was a design failure.

buildup.text: Fadell, who co-designed the iPod, applied Apple-level design thinking to a $250 thermostat.

discovery.text: The Nest learns your schedule, adjusts automatically, and displays a satisfying green leaf when saving energy.

twist.text: Google bought Nest for $3.2 billion. A thermostat was worth more than most tech startups.

climax.text: Nest proved that any product, no matter how mundane, can be transformed by great design.

punchline.text: A thermostat became a status symbol. That's the power of design.

quiz.question: What was revolutionary about the Nest thermostat's design?
options: Applied Apple-level design to a mundane household object
